articles.content:
Koizumi's projected junket to S. Korea protested 
    Pyongyang, October 10 (KCNA) -- The headquarters of the people's movement for expelling excess consumption, the Association of Bereaved Families of Pacific War Victims, the Measure Council for the Issue of Volunteers and other citizens' organizations in South Korea agreed to conduct a signature campaign against the Japanese prime minister's projected junket to South Korea, according to Seoul-based MBC.
 The organizations said that the Japanese prime minister should apologize and compensate before anything else for his approval of the distorted history textbooks and his visit to the Yasukuni Shrine in defiance of public criticism at home and abroad.    
 The organizations announced that they would conduct a 10 million-signature campaign against his junket.

Kim Jong Il sends vehicles to light industry factories
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il sends vehicles to light industry factories 
    Pyongyang, October 10 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il sent vehicles to the Pyongyang Children Foodstuff Factory, the Kyongryon Aeguk Cider Factory and the Kangso Mineral Water Processing Factory.
 This is an expression of his belief and expectation that the factories will contribute to the material and cultural life of the working people by bringing about a great improvement in the production of foodstuff and drink.    
 A meeting for conveying the vehicles was held on Tuesday.
